conclusion: I'll analyze how the shadows of the four objects would change when the light source moves to the right, above the objects.
The image shows four objects on stone slabs: An egg or similar oval object (top left), A red apple (top right), A baseball (bottom left), A microphone (bottom right).

Each casts a shadow on the stone surface. Currently, the shadows appear to be cast slightly to the right of each object, suggesting the light source is positioned somewhat to the left and above the scene.

When a light source moves: Shadows move in the opposite direction from the light source, Shadows become shorter when the light source is more directly above objects, Shadows become longer when the light source is at a lower angle.

premise: If the light source moves to the right (while still above the objects):
conclusion: All shadows will shift to the left (opposite to the light's movement).

premise: If the light source moves to the right (while still above the objects):
conclusion: The shadows that are currently positioned to the right of the objects will move more directly beneath or even to the left of the objects.

premise: If the light source moves to the right (while still above the objects):
conclusion: For objects on the right side (apple and microphone): Their shadows may initially shorten as the light source moves more directly above them, then potentially lengthen again as the light passes over.

premise: If the light source moves to the right (while still above the objects):
conclusion: For objects on the left side (egg and baseball): Their shadows will likely lengthen as the light source moves further away from being directly above them.

premise: If the light source moves to the right (while still above the objects):
conclusion: The shapes of the shadows may change - becoming more elongated or compressed depending on the light angle.

premise: When the light source moves to the right and above the objects:
conclusion: All shadows (A, B, C, and D) will shift their positions to the left.

premise: When the light source moves to the right and above the objects:
conclusion: The shadows of the left objects (egg and baseball) will likely become longer.

premise: When the light source moves to the right and above the objects:
conclusion: The shadows of the right objects (apple and microphone) may initially become shorter then longer again, depending on how far right the light moves.

premise: When the light source moves to the right and above the objects:
conclusion: The overall shadow direction will change, pointing more strongly to the left.

premise: When the light source moves to the right and above the objects:
conclusion: Shadow edges may become sharper or more diffuse depending on how close the light source is to the objects.
